snippet: Congress now has an array of legislative options to prevent the interest rate from doubling to 6.8 percent on July 1, as scheduled.
abstract: Congress now has an array of legislative options to prevent the interest rate on student loans from doubling to 6.8 percent on July 1, as scheduled; loans top $1.1 trillion, held by one in five American households.
lead_paragraph: Congress now has an array of legislative options to prevent the interest rate from doubling to 6.8 percent on July 1, as scheduled.

headline.main: Bills Would Prevent Rise in Student Loan Rates
headline.print_headline: Bills Would Prevent Rise in Student Loan Rates
